intro: Onosma conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. It has narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Onosma conferta is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
